newsitem.title: USA: Disney unit set to release "Blackacidevil" album.
newsitem.headline: Disney unit set to release "Blackacidevil" album.

text.p: Walt Disney Co is set to release an album by Glenn Danzig -- a heavy metal artist whose prior work is noted for satanic themes.

"I think we produce more family-friendly entertainment than any other company in the world by two or three times," said Thomas Deegan, a Disney spokesman, adding that Danzig's material falls within the horror genre.
"It reminds me "Frankenstein". It's kind of Halloweenish."
The album, "Blackacidevil," is set to be released on October 29 by Disney's Hollywood Records as America gears up for Halloween on October 31.
Danzig's earlier albums sold between 200,000 and 500,000 units, according to industry sources.
Industry sources said that Hollywood Records, which was started up about six years ago and has yet to show a profit, paid dearly for Danzig, who has a huge following.
Disney does not break out the record company's results and declined to comment on terms of his contract.
